title: Create my-values.yaml (EKS)
content:
You need to create a my-values.yaml file with the configuration information for your UD/UCMDB deployment in the bastion node.

When creating your my-values.yaml file, keep the following in mind:
  • You need to set the global.externalAccessPort parameter to the port for UD/UCMDB.
  • You need to set the global.externalAccessHost parameter to the FQDN for UD/UCMDB.
  • As UD/UCMDB is installed as the next deployment of Service Management,you need to use the shared IdM (suite IdM) to manage UD/UCMDB users. To do this, make sure that the global.idm.internal parameter to false.  Additionally, you also need to configure the parameters as described in the Service Management integration parameters section.

Create and configure my-values.yaml

You can create and configure a custommy-values.yaml file based on the sample file (values-with-smax.yaml) provided in the UD/UCMDB chart package.

  1. Create a copy of the sample file.

    cp UCMDB_Helm_Chart-2x.x/ucmdb-helm-charts/samples/values-with-smax.yaml my-values.yaml

  2. Edit the my-values.yaml file using any editor and provide the required values in the file.

This my-values.yaml file contains critical configuration information. Many administrative operations are based on this file, for example, UD/UCMDB version upgrade, and enabling TLS connection to databases. The file must be securely stored and backed up regularly.

Configurable parameters

The configurable parameters supported by the UD/UCMDB chart are grouped into the following categories.

Generic parameters

ParameterRequiredDescriptionDefaultExample
acceptEulaYesYou must accept the end-user license agreements to deploy UD/UCMDBfalsetrue
global.docker.registryYesAmazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) where UD/UCMDB docker images are stored.localhost:5000registry.dkr.ecr.region.amazonaws.com
global.docker.orgNameYesAmazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) organization namehpeswitomhpeswitom
global.securityContext.userNo

This parameter specifies the operating system user ID that's used to run the process in the container. The value of this parameter and the ID of the NFS folder owner must be the same. 

Note: The value can't be changed after installation.

1999100001
global.securityContext.fsGroupNo

This parameter specifies the operating system group ID that's used to run the process in the container. 

Note: The value can't be changed after installation.

1999200001
global.nodeSelectorNo

This parameter specifies the nodes to run the process in the container. Set the corresponding node selector tags if you want the UD/UCMDB services to run only on the specified nodes.

The label of the UD/UCMDB worker node specified here must be the same as the one when you Launch EKS cluster worker nodes for UD/UCMDB.

Worker: labelWorker: ucmdb

Shared IdM parameters

For better user management between Service Management and UD/UCMDB, configure the following parameters for UD/UCMDB to use the suite IdM ("shared IdM") to manage UD/UCMDB users.

Parameter Required Description Default Example
global.idm.internal Yes This parameter specifies whether UD/UCMDB uses internal IdM or external IdM. When UD/UCMDB is deployed with Service Management, the value must be false for UD/UCMDB to use suite IdM as the shared IdM. false false
global.idm.idmAuthUrl Yes URL that's used by suite applications to redirect the browser to the IdM login screen. https://<SMA-FQDN>:443/idm-service
global.idm.idmServiceUrl Yes URL that's used by suite applications to communicate with IdM, such as requesting the request token, calling IdM APIs, etc. https://<SMA-FQDN>:443/idm-service
global.idm.idmIntegrationAdmin Yes Name of the UD/UCMDB integration admin user name created in Create UD/UCMDB integration admin user in the suite IdM. cms-integration-admin
global.idm.tenant Yes IdM tenant organization name that's mapped to UD/UCMDB Provider Customer, which is only used for non-business management, so the value should be sysbo. sysbo sysbo


Networking parameters

The networking configuration parameters are set by Load Balancer for accessing UD/UCMDB user interfaces. Make sure you allocate an FQDN for UD/UCMDB (for example, via AWS route 53 services) if you don't have one, and prepare a new certificate for this FQDN.

ParameterRequiredDescriptionDefaultExample
global.externalAccessHostYesSet the value to the FQDN of the load balancer.ucmdb.example.com
global.externalAccessPortYesSet the value to the listening port on the load balancer for accessing UD/UCMDB user interfaces.9443443

global.k8sProvider

Yes

Set the value to identify the type of the managed Kubernetes environment.

Note: You need to manually insert this parameter in the my-values.yaml file and set the value to aws for the EKS deployment.

aws

itom-ingress-controller.nginx.service.httpsPortYes

Set it to a value that doesn't conflict with other applications deployed in the same cluster. For example, if Service Management and UD/UCMDB are deployed in the same cluster, this parameter must be set to a value different than Service Management.

The range of valid ports is 30000-32767.

Note: You need to manually insert this parameter in the my-values.yaml file.

30443

itom-ingress-controller.nginx.service.external.type

Yes

Set the value to ''NodePort' for the managed Kubernetes deployment.

Note: You need to manually insert this parameter in the my-values.yaml file.

NodePort

Configure the following parameters.

TLS parameters for external PostgreSQL

If you want to connect to the external PostgreSQL by using TLS, configure the following parameters:

ParameterRequiredDescriptionDefaultExample
global.database.tlsEnabledNo

Enable TLS connection to database server.

Set it to true if you want to enable TLS.

falsetrue
caCertificatesNo

The content of the database server CA certificate encoded by base-64.

If your certificate isn't base-64 encoded, run the following command on a Linux system to encode the CA certificate:

base64 < pg-ca.pem

caCertificates:
  database.crt: |
    <certificate content
    base-64 encoded>

See the screenshot below.

ucmdbserver.deployment.
database.tlsCert		No

(Required when tlsEnabled is true) The name of the key for the PostgreSQLcertificate defined in the caCertificates parameter.

Note: You need to manually insert this parameter in the my-values.yaml file.

 database.crt
ucmdbprobe.deployment.
database.tlsCert		No

(Required when tlsEnabled is true and global.cms.deployProbe is true) The name of the key for the external PostgreSQL database certificate defined in the caCertificates parameter.

Note: You need to manually insert this parameter in the my-values.yaml file.

probe-postgresql.crt

For more information about the PostgreSQL CA certificate, see Enable TLS connections to external PostgreSQL.

Data Flow Probe database parameters

If you plan to deploy UD/UCMDB with the containerized Data Flow Probe, you need to configure the following database parameters; otherwise, skip them.

ParameterRequiredDescriptionDefaultExample
ucmdbprobe.deployment.database.probeEmbeddedDbNo
  • true (default): The PostgreSQL database embedded in the containerized Data Flow Probe is used
  • false: The external PostgreSQL database is used by the containerized Data Flow Probe 
truefalse
ucmdbprobe.deployment.database.userNoData Flow Probe database user. Do not set it if probeEmbeddedDb is true.probeucmdb_probe
ucmdbprobe.deployment.database.dbNameNoData Flow Probe database name. Do not set it if probeEmbeddedDb is true.dataflowprobeucmdb_probe_db
ucmdbprobe.deployment.database.schemaNoData Flow Probe database schema. Do not set it if probeEmbeddedDb is true.probeprobe

Persistence parameters

ParameterRequiredDescriptionDefaultExample
global.persistence.enabledNoEnables dynamic PVC creation.
 
In production environments, this parameter must be set to true.		truetrue
global.persistence.dataVolumeNameNo

Persistent volume (PV) for storing UD/UCMDB data files.

In this release, you must uncomment this parameter with the default value in my-values.yaml to explicitly specify dataVolumeName: ucmdb-data-volume
ucmdb-data-volumeucmdb-data-volume
global.persistence.configVolumeNameNo

Persistent volume (PV) for storing UD/UCMDB configuration files.

In this release, you must uncomment this parameter with the default value in my-values.yaml to explicitly specify configVolumeName: ucmdb-config-volume
ucmdb-config-volumeucmdb-config-volume
global.persistence.logVolumeNameNo

Persistent volume (PV) for storing UD/UCMDB log files.

In this release, you must uncomment this parameter with the default value in my-values.yaml to explicitly specify logVolumeName: ucmdb-log-volume
ucmdb-log-volumeucmdb-log-volume
global.persistence.dataVolumeStorageClassNameNo

The storage class name of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB data files.

The value must be the same as the storageClassName defined in the corresponding PV. For example, if you specify the storage class name as "gp2" in ucmdb-pv.yaml when creating the PV, use the same value "gp2" here.

gp2
global.persistence.configVolumeStorageClassNameNo

The storage class name of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB configuration files. 

The value must be the same as the storageClassName defined in the corresponding PV. For example, if you specify the storage class name as "gp2" in ucmdb-pv.yaml when creating the PV, use the same value "gp2" here.

gp2
global.persistence.logVolumeStorageClassNameNo

The storage class name of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB log files. 

The value must be the same as the storageClassName defined in the corresponding PV. For example, if you specify the storage class name as "gp2" in ucmdb-pv.yaml when creating the PV, use the same value "gp2" here.

gp2
global.persistence.dataVolumeSizeNoThe requested storage size of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB data files.5G
global.persistence.configVolumeSizeNoThe requested storage size of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB configuration files.5G
global.persistence.logVolumeSizeNoThe requested storage size of the automatically created PVC for UD/UCMDB log files.5G

UD/UCMDB deployment parameters

ParameterRequiredDescriptionDefaultExample
global.sizeYesDeployment size of UD/UCMDB application (small/medium/large)smallsmall
global.cms.timeZoneNoThe time zone used in timestamps of messages produced in UD/UCMDB log files.
 
The time zones have unique names in the form Area/Location. The supported values are described in this web site: List of tz database time zones		UTCAsia/Shanghai
global.cms.deployProbeNo

Deploy the Data Flow Probe in the OMT cluster if true.

 true

false
global.cms.deployGatewayNo

Deploy the UCMDB Gateway in the OMT cluster if true.

By default, this parameter isn't listed in the sample file, and the system uses the default value (true). This is because the component is required when you deploy UD/UCMDB with Service Management. Don't manually set this parameter to false.

truetrue
global.cms.deployDownloaderNo

Deploy the Data Flow Probe installers, the Local Client installers, and the UCMDB API Client jar files for downloading in the OMT cluster if true. 

By default, this parameter isn't listed in the sample file, and the system uses the default value (true). It's recommended that you keep the default value and deploy the component without manually setting the parameter to false.

If you want to disable the Help > Download menu, set the value to false.

true
global.cms.deploySolrNo

Deploy the embedded SOLR service in the OMT cluster if true.

true

The SOLR URL used by UCMDB Server.

UD/UCMDB audit integration parameters

If you want to enable the Audit service for UD/UCMDB, you need to add the following parameters under the IdM component.

 ParameterRequiredDescriptionDefaultExample
auditEngineHostnameYesThe hostname of the audit service deployment. Null. You need to set the value.audit.example.com
auditEnginePortYesThe port in which you deploy the audit service.Null. You need to set the value.9889
auditIntegrationUserYesThe audit integration user that you use to create audits. The user must be the System type and have the CREATE_AUDIT permission to create audit data.Null. You need to set the value.suite-admin
auditNfsPathYesThe path to store audits when audits don't get pushed to the audit engine.var/nfs/auditexample/nfs/audit
caCertificatesYes

The content of the audit CA certificate encoded by base-64.

Get the certificate from the Audit service engine:

  1. Open the Audit engine URL in a web browser: https://<auditEngineHostname>:<auditEnginePort>/audit-gateway?TENANTID=<tenantId>
  2. Download the .pem file.
  3. Convert the .pem extension to .crt. 
    openssl x509 -outform der -in audit_gateway.pem -out audit_gateway.crt

caCertificates:
  audit.crt: |
    <certificate content
    base-64 encoded>

Service Management integration parameters

If you use shared IdM, or if you want to set up Native SACM or enable SAM in Service Management, you must configure the following parameters.

The examples in the following table show the Service Management external access host. However, as a best practice for Service Management integration, we recommend that you isolate internal integration from external access by updating Service Management integration parameters later when you Create Application Load Balancer for integration.
ParameterRequiredDescriptionDefaultExample
cmsgateway.deployment.smax.hostYesThe FQDN of the load balancer for accessing the Service Management APIssmax.example.com
cmsgateway.deployment.smax.portYesThe listening port on the load balancer for accessing the Service Management APIs443443

cmsgateway.deployment.sam.host

(For SAM only) YesThe FQDN of the load balancer for accessing the SAM APIs. The value of this parameter is the same as that of the cmsgateway.deployment.smax.host parameter.smax.example.com
caCertificatesYes

The content of the Service Management CA certificate encoded by base-64.

To get the content of the Service Management CA certificate on AWS, do one of the following accordingly:

  • If you requested a certificate by AWS Certificate Manager during the Service Management installation, see Get the suite CA certificate to the content of the Service Management CA certificate.

  • If you imported a certificate to AWS Certificate Manager during the Service Management installation, use the imported certificate.

You must keep the original format of the certificate without adding any spaces or changing the indentation.

Example:

caCertificates:
  smax.crt: |
    <certificate content base-64 encoded>
